revised_title: Nuclear Division in Small Free-Living Amoebae and Its Impact on Amoebida Classification
tldr: The author conducted a study on nuclear division in nine species of small free-living amoebae under controlled conditions. They discovered that the resting nucleus has a Feulgen-negative nucleolus and Feulgen-positive chromatin granules. The author proposed creating two new families, Schizopyrenidae and Hartmannellidae, based on the types of nuclear division observed. This new classification system aims to improve the understanding of the order Amoebida's phylogeny and evolutionary history.
